p: The introduction of H6 AIVs from the natural reservoir into domestic poultry or mammals other than humans including pigs are typically through direct contact with the infected wild birds or indirectly through viral shedding into the environment via faeces and respiratory secretions [ 8]. Pigs play an important role in AIV infection and were proposed to be the “mixing-vessel” for the emergence of novel pandemic AIVs which were observed in 1957, 1968 and 2009, acting as an intermediate host for zoonotic transmission [ 8].
